inn1.comm: slides the first one down the leg from over the wicket, Dhoni fluffs it and South Africa are gifted two
back of a length and on the stumps to Amla, Zaheer bustles in at 127 kph which is actually an improvement on his Test pace. Amla defends from the crease
exaggerated shuffle across and an attempt to drive on the up. Zaheer's angled delivery across Amla holds its line and carries to Dhoni
back of a length again, Amla tries to force it off the backfoot to the leg side and ends up getting a thick leading edge towards mid on for a quick single
on the corridor outside off and holding its line again. Not much movement yet, with the white ball for Zaheer. Smith leaves
here comes the movement. Zaheer gets one to nip away beautifully from a length and Smith is drawn into a fish outside off. That was close to the outside edge, but missed
Smith's concerned by the previous delivery and jumps across the crease, but Zaheer holds the length back. Smith defends in the end to the off side
Amla has creamed him through the covers. Gentle delivery from Nehra angling across and sitting up for Amla to drive it through the line. He opens the wrists and dispatches it off the front foot
that's a monster wide. Nehra has to rebowl that
tight singe to an alert Raina running in from cover and looking for the under-arm throw, but he fails to collect cleanly
Nehra begins in generous fashion, bowling a perfect delivery for the right hander, to Smith. It drifts harmlessly onto the pads and Smith helps it on its way to the fine leg fence with a neat clip
better line, moves over to off stump and Smith defends to the off side

that's unlucky for Nehra. Smith chips out, can't get to the length of a ball that was dropped shorter on off stump, and he opens the face in an attempt to guide it square. Ends up guiding it much finer than he'd have wanted, and beats the lone slip, for four more
fuller delivery angling into the stumps and Smith is obdurate in defence.
Amla shuffles across, and gets inside the line of a short ball and whips it behind square for one
and again. Zaheer gets another one to dart away off the seam. Smith is concerned, this time he is reluctant to come forward and reaches out half-heartedly for a defesive shot, and misses
better from Smith, gets forward and looks to drive on the up, but can't time it. Plays it towards the covers
Smith skips out of the crease again, and opens the face to steer a back of length delivery behind point for a single
regulation delivery, angling across Amla from over the wicket and he leaves
back of a length again, Amla tries to force it off the backfoot through the off side, but can't time it.
well played by Smith. Nehra targets the pads with a length ball coming in from wide of the crease, Smith presses the front foot across and works it with the angle through midwicket for a couple
crisply drives a length ball on off stump towards mid off
back of a length on middle and Zaheer gets behind the line to defend to the leg side
drifts into the pads, Smith glances it square, but can't find the gap

Kamikaze from Smith. That's a horror shot. A horrendous shot. He was caught at slip, but that was not an outside edge. Smith charges down the track and across, and gets a delivery that was not there for the drive, around off stump. He tries to hoick it across the line, without being in any position to play the shot. He gets a top edge that loops high and nestles in Rohit Sharma's hands as he backpedals from the lone slip. Smith is not Zaheer's bunny today. He has ended up being his own bunny for a change. Smith c Smith b Smith.
back of a length again, Amla forces it off the backfoot, against the angle, towards midwicket for a single
back of a length, Amla stays in the crease and opens the face to defend to the off side
another one on a decent length. Amla again presses back and looks to play him square, but can't make good connection

edged but safe. That will be classified as a drop in some parts of the world. Zaheer gets one to angle across Amla who goes at it hard without feet. A thick outside edge results and it flies past Rohit, diving away to his right from the lone slip.

shot. Amla moves nicely into a check drive through the off side, and picks up three for his effortless push. That was agakin short of driving length, but Amla's magic took the length out of the equation.
back of a length and coming into Ingram who defends from the crease
Ingram attempts an ambitious cut to a short ball, too close to the body and fails to make connection. Though to Dhoni
boy, Amla's smashed that one. Nehra lands a short delivery at a very comfortable line for the pull and Amla obliges. In position in a flash and he goes over the top on purpose.

even better! Amla is going after Nehra here, and I mean literally. He scurries down the pitch and it atleast a foot and a half down the track when he makes contact with what would have been a back of length delivery. He then creams it through the covers with a flourish.

another one spanked on the up through the covers. The boundary at Castle corner is being peppered and Harbhajan at mid off is a tired man. This one was slightly fuller from Nehra and angling across without deviation. Amla reaches across and pounds it in imperious style.
Nehra angles one across and Amla looks to tickle it square, but can't make contact.

timing with a capital T. Nehra over-pitches this time on the stumps and Amla didn't do much really. Just showed it the face of the bat. The next moment, you had Harbhajan running after it down the ground. He manages to slide and save the fourth run
Ingram works a length ball towards square leg, can't get it away for runs
Amla is charging all over the crease. Gets inside the line of a short ball on middle and leg and gets it away off his thighs past Dhoni diving to his left for four leg-byes
fuller delivery this time, Amla times it like a dream, but Harbhajan will be pleased this one came straight to him
Amla skips across yet again, Zaheer feeds him on the pads again and Amla glances it fine for another four. India are bleeding boundaries
holds the length back this time and gets it to angle across, outsicde off. Amla opens the face and defends to the off side
better lines to end the over, back of a length on off stump and Amla forces it back towards Zaheer
tight line, not much movement from back of a length and Ingram defends towards the off side
slightly fuller, but not there for the drive yet. Ingram presses forward and defends compactly

this one is on the driving length on off stump and Ingram punches it off the front foot back down the track. Munaf fields on his follow through. Not much of a follow through for this man - I think Kumble had a more exaggerated one.
another one there and there abouts - Ingram is not going after everything, like Amla. Defends another one to the covers
gets this one to grip on a length and angle across Ingram who leaves
MM Patel - Munaf Maiden Patel. Length ball on off stump, Ingram plays out the over with another defensive push down the track

width for Amla, Zaheer is trying to consciously avoid giving him deliveries on the pads. Amla stays in the crease and flays it without much feet movement and gets it out to the man in the deep backward of point
Ingram tries another forcing shot to a short ball that isn't wide enough for the cut. And misses. On an unrelated note, Ingram's stance and style reminds me of Mark Butcher.
this one angles into Ingram from off towards leg and he works it towards mid of
looks to work one towards the leg side off the off stump line and gets a thick inside edge into the pads. He's still on 0.
Ingram finally opens his account. Short ball without much room and he opens the face to force it through point for one
Amla presses back in the crease, and late. No one knows what he's upto with the footwork. Can't get this one away though - length ball on the stumps, played back down the track
Ingram gets off strike immediately, eases one on the pads behind square on the leg side for a single

that doesn't stop him from skipping out to his first ball from Munaf and looking to launch him over the covers. He doesn't time the shot and it dribbles over and a languid Nehra gives it a distinct 80s style chase. A third run is stolen.
Ingram takes a leaf from Amla's book and chips out of the crease. Can't quite execute the shot though and plays it back to the bowler
on the pads this time and Ingram whips it behind square for another single

slower ball of sorts from Munaf. Not very drastic, the drop in pace, but it had Amla in a little trouble as he lined him up for the expansive drive. Pulled out of the shot at the last moment and guided it to cover-point
no problems this time. Gentle length ball, doing nothing off the pitch and Amla reads the pace early. He lifts it through the line, on the up, over the covers and it is a comfortable boundary
back of a length on off stump, Ingram is out of the crease, but can't get to the length and defends back down the track
back of a length on off stump and forced away with a flourish to Kohli, sweeping at the cover fence
huge appeal turned down. And the right decision too. That landed outside leg and trapped him in front of leg as he shuffled across.
full delivery on off stump, Amla drives it softly towards mid off and pinches another single
on off stump, Ingram stays in the crease and works it to the off side
Ingram's shot selection is a touch awry today. Goes for a pull shot, to a delivery that wasn't all that short. Can't time it as it hurries into him. Dribbles away towards mid-on
length delivery a touch outside off, Amla glides it off an open face towards third man
another slower delivery from Munaf, Ingram is early on the drive and then checks his shot and gets it out towards point
and an effort ball this time. Back of a length and good rise across Ingram, who works it towards third man

ho ho, slower ball to Amla, he saw it coming even before Munaf decided to bowl a slower ball. Goes back in the crease and then reaches out to get to the length and loft it straight over the bowler's head. Lands just short of the boundary.
back of a length, wise decision, and Amla steers it square for a single

Ingram's scratchy innings has ended in a manner that typified his stay out there. Poor shot selection, and poor execution. Short ball, he goes for the pull and is really late on the shot. He ends up skying a top edge towards mid-on. That's that then from Ingram - he never got going today. Munaf has a wicket.

and that's why. He's just walked out. You'd expect him to take time to get his bearings. You'd be wrong. AB walks into a length ball angling across him and eases it off the meat of the bat through the covers. Smooth.
holds the length back this time and AB stays back in the crease and lets it go
fuller ball on the stumps and AB pushes it towards mid on
length ball angling across again, AB refrains from driving and plays defensively to the off side

Arun Lal on air terms this a forgettable delivery. Nehra lands it a foot and a half outside leg stump. And it does nothing off the pitch. It is going harmlessly down the track and AB would have got a wide if he'd let it go. He didn't. Instead, he tapped it on its way to fine leg
ends the over with a dot ball
Amla has raced to fifty. Munaf delivers an off cutter on off stump and Amla clips it towards midwicket with the deviation for a single
good line, on the corridor outside off and AB stays beside the line to defend down the track

Harbhajan's taken a crucial and difficult catch, making it look easier than it was. Amla was on the attack, looking to hit India's seamers out of the attack, but for once, he has mistimed one of those shots. Munaf benefits from keeping it short of a driving length. Amla walks down the track, and goes through with a swat-loft over mid-on despite not getting to the pitch. He doesn't middle it and it loops high over mid-on. Harbhajan runs back and takes it as it comes down over his left shoulder. Good take and end of a sparkling inningss.
full and wide outside the off, AB can't time the drive through the off side
holds the length back, AB gets beside the line and defends to the off side

another good delivery to end the over, Munaf lands it on the McGrath area of uncertainty outside off and gets it to bounce extra. AB is looking to pull out of the shot but ends up steering it to the off side
tossed up on off, Duminy chips out and works it against the spin to midwicket for one
tossed up and straightening into AB who defends with a straight bat. A touch of over spin for Harbhajan there.
wider outside off this time and turning in, AB presses forward and drives into the covers
this time he works it with the spin towards the leg side for a single
JP stays well back to a back of length delivery. Turn and bounce for Harbhajan, JP covers it well and plays to the off side
stays in the crease again, and defends a short of length ball turning away to the off side
Munaf plugs away back of a length outside off, AB guides it carefully towards point
fuller outside off and AB steers it behind point for a cheeky single. AB responded late, but made it in time before Rohit's throw came in. It wasn't the sharpest, and missed the stumps
short ball, tucking JP up in the crease and he hops on the back foot to defend down the track
slightly fuller, but not driving length yet. JP defends as he moves forward, into the off side
sprays this one on the pads and JP works it off the pads for a couple
Munaf gets this one to nip away from middle and off, JP forces it square off the back foot for a single
tossed up on off and turning away, JP comes forward and defends with the spin
holds the length back, on off stump and straightening as JP goes back to defend to the off side
fuller on leg, JP drives down the ground but can't get it past mid-on
tossed up on off stump, JP drops it with an open face in front of point to get a single
on AB's pads, this would have been a good ball to JP. AB taps it away behind square for a single
drives the last ball, also tossed up, through mid-off for a single
Munaf angles one across JP, doesn't offer him room at all, but JP manages to run it off the face towards third man for a single
rare short and wide ball from Munaf, and AB latches on with a powerful cut in front of square. Yuvraj at cover does well, tumbling away to his right to prevent runs
this one is on the pads, AB works it with the angle through midwicket for a couple
another cracking cut to a short ball outside off, but now there is a sweeper on the square boundary to keep it to a single
nice piece of timing from JP. Eases a length ball on off stump past Harbhajan at mid off for a couple.
looks to drive through the off side again, slower ball, fuller on off stump but this time he finds the fielder at cover.
turns it off the pads in front of square
tossed up on middle and off, JP reaches out to get to the pitch and defends to the off side

big appeal for lbw, and not a bad one, but it is turned down. JP is well down the track, but was hit in line and this may have well gone on to his the stumps. There was however too much doubt and it wasn't given
smart, if somewhat dangerous shot. That held its line and was coming in,m cramping JP for room before he deftly opened the face and guided it fine at the last moment, for a couple
stays back in the crease and works a length ball off the pads for a single towards square leg
JP skips out immeduiately and works it off the pads towards midwicket. That should have been a single, but Yuvraj wa sloppy in collecting the return and allowed a second.
fuller on middle and off, JP works it back cautiously towards midwicket
skips out again, looks to work him with the spin towards midwicket, but can't the single
this time he finds the gap, between midwicket and square leg side for one
AB turns the strike over again, working him off the pads towards square leg
JP opens the face and looks to work him square, but can't elude point
turns in from outside off, AB stays back and whips him through midwicket
turns away from outside off, JP stays back and slashes it square for a single
easy singles on offer, Rohit pushes this onto AB's pads and he clips it away sedately through square leg
JP stays back and looks to cut through the off side, but is cramped for room and can't time it
he gets the single this time, staying back in the crease and driving into the covers, with the spin
AB stays on the crease and punches back to the bowler
flighted on the pads, JP charges out and takes it on the full. He works it through midwicket for a single
tossed up outside off and straightens into AB who reaches out and looks to drive against the spin into the off side
straighter line this time and AB works it with the spin through wide mid on for one
nifty running. JP stays back in the crease, opens the face and runs it square. These two run like the wind, and pick a single where others may not have even considered it
flighted generously outside off, AB reaches across and looks for the square drive, but can't place it too well
similar ball, AB drives down the ground this time and gets a single past wide mid off
speared in from wide of the crease and straightening into AB who plays it back down the track
AB plays with an angled face and drives a flighted ball between point and cover for one
landed on middle and leg, JP works it with the spin off the front foot, but can't get it past the bowler
stays back in the crease and makes enough toom to chop a short delivery just outside off for one through point
length ball outside off, AB defends down the track
ooh, he's sucked into the drive early and plays it airily, but there is no one close in around the cover area to snaffle it
Harbhajan drifts onto the pads, and AB nurdles him fine. Boy, these guys run like Usain Bolt. Three to the cause.
flighted on off, JP pushes out and drives towards mid off
JP drives again through the off side, but uses the wrists to play it squarer and gets a single
AB plays a defensive on-drive past Harbhajan and turns the strike over, once again.
JP charges out, and is close to halfway down the track when he meets a ball on leg stump. He clips it through midwicket and has enough of a headstart to pick two
goes back in the crease now to cut him behind point for one more. Finally, some urgency in the middle overs. Eight from that over.
JP skips out again, takes a full delivery on the full and works it through midwicket for one
first real sign of spin. Yuvraj gets one to grip and turn away from a bemused AB's leg stump. He defends cautiously
this one scurries through with the arm and AB uses the pace to work it behind square leg for a couple
stays back in the crease and taps him with the spin into the covers for another single. This innings is now up and 'running'
JP presses across and works Yuvraj with the spin, but can't beat mid-on
stays back in the crease and plays him into the covers for a single to end the over. Honours even at the halfway stage of the innings, but SA seem more keen on taking the initiative.
flighted on off and JP somehow manages to find the gap between the bowler and silly mid off, for a single
a touch of top spin as this one hurries into AB from middle and leg line, he calmly turns it into the leg side for a single
JP stays back in the crease and guides this with the spin for a single behind square
looks to play him behind square through the off side, but can't beat short third

AB! Looked like he sliced that one. But it carried easily over the straight boundary. If he'd timed it, it would have landed in Jo'burg. Tossed up on off, AB prances out, gets close to the pitch, but doesn't quite middle the tee-off down the ground. It didn't matter. It just kept going!
Bhaj holds the length back and AB stays in the crease to pat it back to the bowler
JP charges out to Yuvraj who holds the length back and he ends up playing it carefully towards midwicket
he runs down the track again and plays all around a straight ball. Manages to get a leg bye towards the off side
AB drives him easily into the covers for another single
SA are taking control here. Lovely hit from JP. He's down the track again, gets to the length of a flighted ball on the stumps and slams it with the spin over midwicket.
and now the single, works him off the pads in front of square and hands it to AB
faster ans flatter on AB's stumps, he deflects it behind square for another single. They think of two and then decide against it
back of a length coming in, AB works it off the pads towards midwicket for a single
holds the length back again, and JP steers him behind square for the 150th run

you can bowl all the line and length you want, but when the field is in, you could do with pace and movement. Or yorkers. Not a length ball outside off, says AB who rocks on the backfoot and slams the pull shot with disdain, in the air. It lands a couple of metres inside the ropes.
AB looks to open up the off side and carve him over cover-point, but can't elude the field. Picks a single
JP looks to deflect a short ball in line with the stumps through third man. Can't make contact though
this time he gets the single, into the covers to retain strike. 8 off the first PP over. Four to go.
length ball on off, not much pace and JP comes forward and across to work it across towards midwicket. He played it soft and ran hard. The result is two more.
this one slides onto the pads, JP manages to get a single away off the pads towards the leg side
mid-off is standing deep in the circle and really straight. That allows him to run across and stop an improperly timed straight drive from AB

Munaf at gully. Yes, you read right. And yes, you predicted right too. He dives clumsily over a steer from outside off stump and gifts Duminy four. Munaf at gully. Don't think a worse fielder has ever manned that position.
JP is running them crazy here. There is no one inside the circle on the leg side. JP gets across to off stump and tickes another one square towards the leg side and hares across for a couple
full delivery on the pads and this time, JP times the nurdle too well for a couple. SA are assuming control here.
tight line outside off, straightens as JP looks to cut it away. Can't get the gap
this time he bolts for a tight single to Yuvraj at point. Yuvraj fired in the throw, but missed. JP was diving in though.

AB has played the shot of the day. Full ball on middle and off, AB switches his stance and plays a sort of reverse flick, past the packed in-field in the covers for four. Fifty, comes up with a gorgeous shot
AB drives him into the covers and takes another single
JP tries to drive with the spin, but plays it straight to the covers. 25 off the first three PP overs.
full ball, angling in after landing on leg stump and AB plays all over it as he looks to ship across the line. No appeal as they take a leg bye
back of a length outside off and JP chops it behind square for a single
full ball on off stump and AB goes down on a knee and mows across the line for a single to deep midwicket
huge lbw appeal, turned down. Zaheer gets reverse swing this time, it tails in drastically into JP moving across his stumps and hits his back leg in front of leg stump, but it may have strayed down
perfect yorker, AB can't do much with it and digs it back to the bowler from middle and leg
a good delivery followed by an ordinary one. Back of a length ball sliding down the leg and he gets it away towards fine leg for a couple.
short ball, JP goes for a wild pull and misses. His shot selection confused Dhoni too and they take a bye
take that Nehra, says AB. Short lengths in the Powerplay, not very imaginative from Nehra. AB swivels back and brutalises it with a horizontal bat through midwicket for four

oh boy, he follows up violence with poetry. Nehra wants to cramp him for room and keeps it on leg stump as AB moves to the leg side. AB didn't have room for the cut, so he just drove him inside out, smooth as a Rolls Royce, over the covers.
and another hat-trick of fours for Nehra, who is having a shoddy day here. Full and wide outside off, enough room for the cut this time and AB happily carves it square for four more

appeal for lbw turned down, appeal for run out turned down. AB was walking across and looking to nurdle him across the line. That may have landed outside leg. AB started running when Dhoni collected and fired a throw at the striker's end, but he was back in time.
after five forgettable deliveries, Nehra gets the perfect PP length. The horse, however, has already bolted. 45 runs in the PP as AB digs it out to the covers for one
tossed up on the stumps and AB drives expansively into the covers for one
slides a mile down the leg side. Was Yuvraj confused by the adjacent track?
JP stays beside the line and opens the face to steer him for a single towards third man
tossed up on off, AB drives down the ground for another single
JP goes back in the crease and punches towards long on to bring up a fine fifty
singles for the taking. AB works this with the spin straight to backward point standing on his heels and ambles across
JP stays in the crease and looks to whip off the pads as Yuvraj's delivery stays low in line with leg stump. Can't get it past the fielder though
on the pads from Nehra, easily worked off the pads towards deep backward square leg for a single. SA reach 200
Nehra gets some reverse now, tails into JP who spots it and manages to on-drive for one
back of a length on the pads and AB clips him off the backfoot, behind square for one more
JP gets one on the pads and glances it fine, some quick movement from the fine leg fielder keeps it down to one
back of a length outside off and steered square for a single
short ball, no pace on it and AB slaps it like an errant child for a couple towards midwicket. Drinks break, India won't mind the interval at all.
JP flicks him square with the spin for a single
AB cuts but straight to cover
Yuvraj strays onto the pads and AB works him behind square for one
JP merely taps him to the leg side off the pads and they scurry away for one
full and wide outside off, AB crunches it square for a single to the deep
JP skips across to middle, gets inside the line and tickles another one from the pads towards backward square leg for one
speared into the pads, JP stays in the crease and forces him through midwicket for one

It's been a day replete with bad balls, and Rohit had picked a wicket with one of them. Rank bad delivery, the longest of long hops, turning in and asking to be sent out of the ground as it turns into AB. He sets himself up for the pull, and must have been wondering whether he wanted to hit this to the moon or merely into the stands. Somehow, he managed to get it straight to Harbhajan at deep midwicket. Rohit celebrates in Brett Lee, Kevin Pieterseneque fashion.
works the first ball with the spin into the covers
drops this one short and he cuts it away square, Harbhajan does well on the boundary to keep it to two
flatter and on the stumps, played with the spin to the covers again
another one defended with the spin towards midwicket
tossed up on leg stump, driven solidly down the ground for one
flighted on leg stump from wide of the crease, Miller defends with over-stated caution
flighted on off and middle, driven with the spin towards mid off
JP looks for yet another nurdle into the leg side but can't get it away
this time JP skips out and gets to the pitch. Flicked away square for a single
ah, Raina gets an outside edge out of Miller, but it scurries quickly past Dhoni and goes down to ground too. A couple of runs are taken.
speared in from wide of the crease and JP works it off the pads to the leg side
this one straightens from off stump, it is driven into the off side
this time he picks the single, he reaches out and drives it down the ground
worked to backward point for a single
this time he stays back and guides into the covers for a single
they are toying with the attack here. Miller drives into the off side for another single

finally a wicket to a good delivery. Raina slips one through Miller's defences. It landed on off stump and hurried through as Miller shaped to guide it square. He missed and leather crashed into timber. That delivery actually pressed back off stump. Raina is pleased. India have a chance to tie things up here - barring Duminy, SA are out of batsmen. Botha and the seamers to follow.
works the first ball with the spin towards wide mid on for one
JP presses forward and defends to the off side
shorter, JP goes back in the crease and steers through square for one.
played off the backfoot to short fine leg.
forces this towards midwicket, can't find the gap. JP holds the key for SA here. India will love to find a way past him.
boy, Rohit gets one to grip and turn sharply into Botha's pads. Stifled appeal, turned down. That turn will excite Botha.
and this one squeezes down the leg side. Dhoni's appeal is turned down, and wide is not signalled. Did that hit anything? Replays awaited.
Botha gets away, taps this one into the covers and gets the single
JP jumps out, gets to the spin and drives softly towards long on for one
Botha presses forward and across, gets inside the line and works Rohit round the pads to the leg side
JP trots out yet again, and drives wide of mid on for another single
JP taps into the covers and they steal a tight single. A direct hit from Kohli would have caught Botha short. Dhoni could not collect cleanly, in any case.
short and turning in from outside off, Botha stays back and cuts for a single
JP picks one of his innumerable singles to long on
short ball turning in, Botha essays the forehand cross court with a touch of top spin, to long on for one

another short ball, JP pulls now and Harbhajan gets into a tangle as he looks to slide on the rough area around deep midwicket. Hit foot got stuck in the turf and he seems to have hurt his knee a bit. Boundary saved, though.
full toss on leg stump, JP bunts to wide long on for another single
short stuff everywhere, JP rocks back and looks to cut. Yuvraj's dive at cover saved the boundary
JP flicks away in front of square, and gets a single
another short ball, Botha gets into position for the cut, but doesn't time it too well. There is sweeper cover in place, and it is a single
Botha cuts this time and takes a single through square
Botha's pre-meditated reverse sweep goes awry as the ball lands outside off. Somehow manages to get a single behind square on what was off side when he took guard.

Oh no, JP has reverse-swept himself back to the pavilion. Full and on middle from Rohit, JP quickly shifted stance and looked to get it between point and third man, but he missed. That looked plumb. Umpire Erasmus took his time, though, but eventually ruled in Rohit's favour. Huge scalp for India.
turning in from outside off, Botha works it with the spin wide of mid on for one
Parnell gets off the mark, driving with the spin towards long off
gully cricket shot from Botha, laboured lofted tap wide of the bowler, for a single towards mid off
Parnell drives down the ground  for one
Botha stays back to a full ball and carves it through the covers without any timing. The field is set back, so they get two
gets back in the crease and defends a ball turning in from outside off, down the track
turns away from outside off, JP taps it behind square for one
this one's short and turning down the leg side and it is pulled away behind square for one
turning away from outside off, JP drives towards extra covers
short ball again, turning down the leg and Botha gets only a single towards fine leg
Botha comes forward and looks to work to the leg side, but can't get it away. Some excitement from Dhoni behind the stumps.
tossed up on off stump, Botha drives it back towards Harbhajan

rare sighting. Munaf and Nehra come together to save a boundary in the deep. Tossed up and turning down the leg, Botha goes for the sweep and gets some top edge, but it lands safe. Munaf trots across from fine leg and taps it into the field just as it was bouncing out. Nehra teams up with him to throw it back in.
lovely bowling, Botha gets the quicker one on middle and off and plays it back to the bowler
speared into the pads, Botha works it away behind square for one
good over, Parnell can't make the last ball count. Flighted and turning away, played into the covers off the front foot
turning down the leg, worked along with the spin to short fine leg for one
on the pads, Parnell stays in the crease and works it through midwicket for one
full and fast on the toes, Botha swishes it away through square leg for a single
on Parnell's pads, he looks for the glance, but can't get it away
turning away from back of a length on middle stump, Parnell comes down the track and slaps against the turn to long on
full on leg stump, laboured down the ground to long on for one.
straighter one, Botha goes for the sweep and the extra bounce on the topspinner makes him miss. Half-appeal from Dhoni for caught behind, but turned down
hideous delivery from Harbhajan. Full toss on off and even Botha, who hasn't timed anything today, is able to slam it down the ground past long on for four

The revenge of the offspinner. Harbhajan delivers a full delivery turning in from around off stump. Botha looks to mow him to the leg side and misses. Stumps are down. Harbhajan has the look that seems to say, "Gotcha, my man."
straighter one straying down the leg side, steyn gets across and then works it away square for one
Harbhajan gets one to grip and spin away from Parnell's attempt to steer. Play and a miss
straightens from middle and leg, Parnell looks to flick and misses.
back of a length, angling across Steyn who opens the face and guides it towards point
mistimes a drive to Yuvraj at covers who swoops on the ball and then chooses to not throw. A scrambled single is taken.
slower ball, Steyn is foxed by it and is early into the shot as he looks to whack across the line. A stiff breeze is set up by his swing, but the ball heads to Dhoni.
short ball just outside off, Steyn opens the face and guides towards third man for one
full ball, Parnell drives down the ground for one
smart change in length, Steyn did not expect a short ball and ended up poking it away from the line of off stump into the off side for one
golly, Harbhajan breaks the 100kph barrier. Fired in at 105 kph according to the broadcast, that medium-pacer did not turn and Steyn did not even get close to making contact as it whizzed past
another fast one, this time on the stumps and Steyn gets a single to long on
mowed away, this one was on middle and leg and Parnell could not quite get the elevation, so two to cow corner
this time he rocket launches it over the ropes. Another full ball on middle and leg, asking to be slog swept and Parnell obliged in comprehensive style
short and fast, Parnell stays put in the crease and dinks it to short third man for a single
drives another flat and full delivery down the ground for a single. Harbhajan's spell ends with an expensive over.
short ball, angled into the body and Parnell is surprised by the length and his hand comes off, as he looks to steer it square
Zaheer gets Steyn again. Another short ball, from round the wicket. Steyn goes for the pull, but has no room to pull it off. Loops the top edge towards mid on and it is easily taken.
a rare perfect yorker. I can recall exactly one more in this innings, also from Zaheer. Reverse swing into the left hander who digs it out to long off for a single

another yorker, another wicket. Zaheer gets one to snake through Morkel's defense. He stays in the crease and looks to somehow keep the reverse swinging delivery away from his pads, but he could not save the furniture. Leg stump is hit.
back of a length outside off, Tsotso steers behind point for a single. Can India bowl SA out? Counts for nothing.
no they can't. Attempted yorker, this time tails into the pads on the full and Parnell whips it away square for a couple in front of square

inn2.comm: eerily similar start to SA's innings when there were two wides down the leg. This time it is just one
full delivery outside off and a hint of away movement, Vijay reaches forward and defends
and he's away with a neat clip off the pads as Steyn goes too straight. Single through square leg
full delivery searching for Sachin's pads first up, he moves across and flicks it crisply in front of square leg for a single as well

Vijay's gone. Steyn's begun the damage early. Straight ball, headed towards the pads in front of off stump. Vijay tries the whip across the line without moving the feet and is beaten for pace. The ball has thudded into the pad and the appeal is well and truly on by the time he plays the shot and looks befuddled. And then it is upheld. 3/1
aiming for the pads again, Kohli has the tendency to plonk the front foot across early and play across it, but manages to get it away towards square leg off the inside half this time
this time he gets it away behind square with a more in-control clip for a single

and where does the ball go? Straight to where second slip would have been. Good delivery from Tsotso, lifter that nipped away from a leaden footed Kohli who just hung the bat out without conviction. It flew at catchable height through the gap in the cordon.
another one that bounces extra, outside Sachin's off stump and he leaves
fuller delivery, angles across as Sachin presses forward to defend it
again, extra zip from the track, Sachin stays in the crease and drops it to the leg side with a surprised look
full and well wide outside off, Sachin gets across and leaves. Close to a wide that one
Sachin moves back and across to a short ball and whips it off the back foot towards square leg for one
timing becomes him. Fast and full from Steyn, Sachin gets inside the line and coaxes it with a turn of the wrists through midwicket. Couple taken as the ball slows up in the now heavy outfield
draws him outside off with a full delivery, Sachin leans into a check drive into the covers and gets a single
Kohli stays beside the line and defends from the crease. That one did not bounce much from back of a length
nice shot and very good fielding. Kohli stays on his back foot and clips it crisply as he rides the bounce and Ingram at midwicket dives to the left to save runs
this one drifts down the leg side, Kohli gets inside the line and glances it away to fine leg for a couple
gets behind this one outside off and defends compactly to the off side
Sachin again tries to move across outside off and work Tsotso through the leg side, but can't get it away this time

whoa, early intent from Sachin. Full delivery angling across and Sachin decides to bash it back down the ground. Tsotso managed to get a hand on it, but that was not a chance by any stretch of the imagination. It slowed up near the outfield and the umpire checks whether it touched the rope before it was dragged in by Parnell. The running was poor - they assumed it was going to be four. But it wasn't, only two to Sachin.

Tendulkar has perished. He has fallen trying to again walk across to Tsotsobe and work him through the leg side. This time Tsotso gets that extra bounce going again. It got big on Sachin from short of a length as he looked to close the face on a paddle shot, and he ended up top-edging it behind short fine leg. Easy take for Steyn who ran back from the circle and set himself up for it. India are wobbling. No 200 for Sachin today. Not even close.
sharp lift outside Kohli's off stump this time and he leaves
fuller outside off, Kohli comes forward and defends into the covers for a single.
Tsotso welcomes him with a bouncer that buzzes past around leg stump line as he ducks
length ball on middle and leg, Kohli gets behind the line and defends
comes forward to a fuller length ball and pushes into the covers for another single
oh boy, that one took off from just short of a length. Rohit had no ambitions of playing a shot and AB could not haul it in as he leapt high. Four byes to India, four worrying byes.
slower ball on off stump, Rohit spots it and opens the face to steer a single through point
through him in a trice with sheer pace. Kohli had no chanceof getting bat on Steyn's fastest ball of the day
slower ball attempted again, and this time he slides down the leg side with it

Kohli's feet are rooted in Durban as he flashes at a ball that was going through Jo'burg. He got a thick outside edge, which safely flew through the slip cordon and reached the fine leg boundary in Cape Town.
again Tsotso gets one to sit up sharply from back of a length. Rohit does well to ride the bounce and defend to the off side
back of a length again, Rohit comes half forward and defends

slip-catching practice from Rohit. Dangles the bat out with an open face without moving across to a delivery that's searching for exactly that kind of shot. Luckily for Rohit it did not carry to Botha diving at second slip
overcooks the bouncer and it is a wide for height
very early on the drive to the off side, and again without moving the feet. Ends up shoving it straight back the bowler for one.
Kohli stays beside the line and drops a lifter on off stump to the off side
there's a lot of fishing here, but so far they are somehow eluding the bait. Kohli pokes from the crease at another one from Tsotso angling across. It missed everything on the way to AB
back of a length and jagging in sharply off the seam. Arms shouldered by Rohit
another nothing shot from Rohit. Stays rooted to a loaded short ball and looks to play some sort of a square dab. Didn't make any contact.

jaffa. Not many batsmen could have got bat on it, and if they did, it would have been an edge to the slips. It comes in with the angle, lands back of a length around off and then straightens. Rohit is squared up and ends up looking rather ungainly. Can't blame him for that.
extra bounce again, Rohit defends very softly and it bounces near the stumps, forcing him to play another shot at it to keep it away
the pace is increasing steadily from Morne. Rohit gets behind this one and defends to the off side with more assurance
shot. Rohit is in position for the back foot cover drive early and smokes it on top of the bounce, but this outfield has become really slow now.
length ball on leg, Kohli gets across and works around his pads to square leg for one
Tsotso gets another one to dart up and jerk away from Rohit who stays well inside the line and lets it go

interesting shot from Rohit, but he gets four for it. There is extra bounce for Tsotso, this time Rohit decides to use it to his advantage, by staying beside the line and slapping it airily in front of square. He had the shot under complete control though it was a creation of his own
looks for the backfoot punch through the covers, but can't find the gap. Good timing, though
angles wide of off stump as Rohit looks for the steer through point. Can't get it away for runs though
back of a length and very straight, no room for the cut but Rohit goes for the shot anyways. Can't find the gap though he executes the stroke well
Kohli attempts a steer and gets it off the outside half torwards third man for a single
another sharp lifter outside off, Rohit looking more assured now as he lets it go
just as I say that, he gets squared up by one that holds its line as he fishes outside off. Misses the outside edge, but not by much
away movement off the seam again, this time Rohit covers it well and steers towards point.

oh boy. He goes for a front foot cover drive. To a back of a length ball. From the fastest bowler of the day. Who is also the tallest man playing today. No surprise that he got nowhere near connecting with it.
this time Morne slants into Rohit's body and he gets inside the line to glance it fine for a couple
back of a length, finishes outside off, Kohli is compact in defending from the crease
Kohli looks to slam a cover drive on the up, but can't time it too well. It went in the air, but safely through the covers and slowed up before Parnell tagged it down.
nice footwork from Kohli, skips inside the line and clips Tsotso off the hips through midwicket
back of a length on off stump, Rohit stays in the crease and defends with the full face
hmm, Rohit attempts a cut shot to a ball that was through him before he knew it. Extra bounce again from Tsotso, and not enough room for the shot.
for the second time today, Rohit mis-hits a cover drive so badly that it ends up going straight down the ground. Parnell tidies up from mid off and they take a single

Morne squares up Rohit once again, and this time Umpire Taufel reckons he got the edge. Unplayable stuff from Morne. Comes in with the angle from wide of the crease, lands back of a length outside off and then nips away, to go with monster bounce. Rohit shapes for the normal forward defensive, but ends up almost facing up to the bowler. That's how far it opened him up. Did he edge it? He's not pleased with the decision. Replays awaited. There was a noise as it passed him. It was the noise of bat hitting pad. Rohit's got a rough one here.
Yuvraj is away with a flick to fine leg as Morne lands one on his toes. All these batsmen did not have time to acclimatise like the Test batsmen did, before and during the Tests.
better line, gets it to jump up outside off, Yuvraj watches closely and leaves
closer to off stump and Yuvraj defends softly

Yuvraj comes, Yuvraj goes, India slip further down. Another snorter outside off, but Yuvraj could have chosen to let it go on length, if not line. He jumped up in the crease and went for a heavy-handed poke that looped off the outside edge for an easy catch to Smith at first slip. Morne is on fire. He has the Indians hopping away under lights.
length ball on off stump, Dhoni shuffles across to cover the line and nurdles to the leg side
drifts into Kohli's pads and he misses out as he attempts to flick. Straight to square leg
drops a length ball outside off softly into the covers for a quick single
Dhoni attempts that helicopter whip slash of his over third man. Ideally suited for the IPL and for the slog overs. Here, he missed it by an year as the ball flew across
Dhoni gets behind the line and punches down the ground. Good timing, but mid off intercepts

close-run thing, but Kohli seems to have made it, despite looking back at mid off as he ran to the striker's end. Dhoni taps it gingerly straight and to the left of the pitch and takes off. Kohli wants to know what Parnell si doing behind him as he runs across. Parnell picks and throws the stumps down at the striker's end, but Kohli made it.
picks a single to end the over.
back of a length and whizzing past with good carry and Kohli lets it go
Morne strays onto the pads and Kohli clips him through midwicket for a couple. He has so far looked the best batsman for India.
stays in the crease, focusing on covering the line as he defends a back of length ball down the ground
Morne draws him out with a slightly fuller ball and Kohli defends to the off side
pushes him back this time, Kohli rides the bounce and defends to the leg side
looks to slash him from outside off, but completely mis-times the shot
back of a length ball on middle and Dhoni gets behind the line in his own grotesque style to defend down the track
Dhoni stays back and looks to punch a delivery angling across him. He plays it uppishly and just past the point fieldsman, all the risk for a single
another one back of a length outside Kohli's off stump and he defends to the off side
Kohli eases a length ball down the ground for a single.
Dhoni stays back and looks to smash a back of length ball over mid-on. Can't find the gap though

whoa, Dhoni is looking to finish this in a hurry. Or something like that. Looks to launch a length ball down the ground, gets too much under it and swirls it into the Durban night. For a moment, it would have been deja vu for Steyn running back - he injured himself badly attempting a similar catch in the Champions League, in this very ground. This one was too far from him though and he did not put in the dive.
back of a length and angling across from over the wicket, Dhoni stays back and looks to slap on the up, but can't find the gap
a defensive shot from the Dhoni book of batting. Back of a length and reasonable bounce in line with off stump, Dhoni falls over as if he were dealing with a grubber, but kept it to the leg side
this time he times and places the back foot punch through the covers well, and gets a couple for his efforts
back of a length again, Dhoni tries to force him down the ground and it goes off the bottom off the bat for a single
Kohli rises on his back foot and works it off the pads towards square leg
opens the face and guides the last ball through point for one
Kohli comes across and works him with the spin to long on for one
Dhoni works him softly towards mid on, who flicks the ball to Botha who then hurls it towards AB. Clockwork fielding from SA!
leans out to one tossed well outside off and drives towards the covers
speared in from wide of the crease, Dhoni gets behind the line and defends
tossed up well outside off, Dhoni lunges across to get to the pitch and plays into the covers for one
Dhoni taps a short length ball backward of point and Kohli runs across easily for a hustled single
full length outside off, Kohli is a little late on the drive and squirts it off the inside half to the leg side
back of a length on leg stump, Kohli looks to whip through the leg side, but plays it straight to mid on

full and searching delivery angling across Kohli, who drives it crisply off the front foot, but Miller at cover was alert to put in the dive. Bad bounce, hits him in the chest and his cruel team-mates laugh!
full on the stumps and Kohli drives back on the bounce to Parnell
another driving length ball to end the over, another crisp drive that's not placed well. Straight to mid off this time
Dhoni looks to steer a topspinner through third man, but can't beat the man in the circle
another toppie, on off stump, Dhoni gets across to the off stump and nudges it to the leg side for one
flighted on off stump, Kohli drives it cleanly down to long on for one
Dhoni jumps out, gets to the pitch and looks to launch Botha with the spin over the leg side, but the extra spin takes it away from the middle of the bat and he picks a couple to deep midwicket
single to sweeper cover this time, off the back foot
ooh, Kohli nearly pops a return catch to a tossed up delivery outside off. Lands just short of Botha.
Dhoni gets well back and across to slap a back of length ball into the covers
short ball, but not enough pace to hustle Kohli who plays the pull shot for a single to square leg
Dhoni stays beside the line and looks to crack it square off a horizontal bat, but finds point. The fumble allows the single
back of a length on off stump and Kohli gets the leading edge as he tries to flick. It runs away safely through a now mosrtly vacant slip cordon through to third man
full delivery outside off, Dhoni gets his front foot across and drives into the covers
back of a length to end the over, Dhoni decides to leave
turns in from outside off, Kohli works it off the pads towards midwicket for one
short and a touch outside off, enough for Dhoni to force it away with a cut shot, fine of point for a couple
toppie again, Dhoni stays back, spots the deviation and gets it away towards short third man where Parnell does well to stop it
short and wide outside off, Dhoni slaps it towards deep cover for one
Kohli reaches out and plays with the spin towards midwicket
he gets the single now, driving into the covers after leaning out to a tossed up delivery outside off
called a wide for sliding down the leg, but this clipped Kohli's pads on the way
Kohli struggles for timing this time, lets the bottom hand take over as he tries the cover drive and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
length ball angling across, pushed defensively into the covers
over-pitched on the pads and Kohli can't make it count, flicking straight to square leg
back of a length outside off, Kohli guides it into the covers and Dhoni sends him back as he looks for single. India falling behind in a hurry.
and finally he gets a single. Short ball angling across and he clips it off the hips for a single to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, Dhoni covers the line and defends square to the off side
Kohli goes downtown, and in some style. He dances down the track, gets to the flight of Botha's ball outside off and tees off down the ground, over long off for a sublime six

another boundary, India have hit as many boundaries in the last two balls, as they did in the previous 21 overs. Botha over-compensates, short and wide outside off, and Kohli whacks it away in front of square
back of a length outside off, Kohli picks a single to the off side
Dhoni joins the act, he chips out now and brutalises Botha with a clean strike down the ground.
looks for a single to the leg side, but he can't get it past mid on
anti-climactic end to the over, short ball, turning in, Dhoni works it towards Botha
Kohli flashes hard outside the off stump and picks a single towards third man
Dhoni plays the backfoot sledge-hammer drive down the ground to a full ball outside off, and gets a single to long off
back of a length outside off, Kohli drives softly towards mid off for another single
full on the stumps, Dhoni taps it into the covers and they run like possessed hares. Kohli makes his ground before Miller hits the stumps

oh, well. Dhoni has been Kallised. Or Laxmaned. It's amazing how many times this has happened in this series. Kohli times a straight drive perfectly, and Parnell just about gets a finger on it before it crashes into the stumps at the bowler's end. Kallis was stunned. Laxman was shocked. Dhoni just walks back without showing emotion.
Kohli clips the last ball through midwicket for a single
turning in from a length, Kohli eases it with the spin towards square leg
turns away and Raina nearly edges into slip's hands. Half-steered, half-edged for a couple
reaches out and covers the spin this time as he defends
speared into the pads, Raina clips him square for a single
angled in from wide of the crease, Kohli stays inside the line and works it square for another single
turning away from short of a length, Raina adjusts better for the steer and guides it in front of point for a single
and immediately hustles him with a fast delivery back of a length. Raina stays in the crease and defends
short ball, but down the leg side. Easy leave, and this format it is called a wide
horror ball, horror shot. Short and wide outside off from Steyn, this was probably a Test match wide. Raina tries to become Superman and slash it. And misses. Wide.

Raina shows exactly how not to play that short ball aimed at the head. He jumps back, takes the eyes off, leaves the bat making an obtuse angle with the ground. And belatedly takes the bottom hand off. It pops up on the off side. Good thing no one was there to take it
and he runs away from the strike. Drops a short ball into the off side for one
sprayed into the pads and Kohli tickles down to fine leg for one
attempted short ball, this time it doesn't jump up at hom and Raina manages to get behind the line and defend
stays back to another ball short of a length and defends to the off side
turns into the pads and Kohli works it with the spin for a single
tossed up on off from round the wicket, textbook forward defensive from Raina
strays onto the pads and Raina glances straight to short fine leg who flicks it straight back at the keeper. Raina has to hurry back in
Raina chips out and drives down to long off for a single
Kohli works him with the spin for a single to long on
Raina tickles one drifting onto the pads, once again straight to short fine leg
Kohli rocks back and looks to pull a half tracker, but can't quite get it away. Single towards wide long on
Raina stays in the crease and clips against the spin through midwicket for one
another shortish ball, Kohli punches off the back foot to long on for one
another short ball that's been let off. Raina flat bats it straight to cover
fuller on middle and leg, Raina comes out to the pitch and drives back down the track
similar ball, similar result, driven to the off side of the pitch and JP cleans up

short ball again, Kohli goes back and drives to long on for a very important 50. Forget the result of this game - this is a good innings in extremely difficult circumstances and bodes well for India's batting.
Raina skips out to the pitch of the ball and works Botha inside out with the spin for a couple through covers
comes out of the crease again, but ends up yorking himself as he plays to the off side of the pitch
ho ho hoick. Raina jumps out again, the ball is on leg stump line and he simply goes through with the slap-flick over cow corner. That carried over the ropes
defends this one off the front foot back to the bowler

Raina has just gotten away with the day's ugliest shot. So ugly that @HoldingWilley says "Raina nearly handed Yusuf his World Cup spot". He stays in the crease and goes for a mad slog sweep to a ball that wasn't in the slot and gets a big top edge. IT swirls in the air as Miller runs back, Parnell runs in and a third fielder also coverges. It falls between them at midwicket.
works a length ball from leg stump towards midwicket for one
Kohli drives with aiuthority against the spin into the covers for a couple
this time he plays it more softly for a single
Raina looks to score through the off side, but can't make good connection. He's looking on edge here
and again, nothing shot to a ball that wasn't there for the drive or the pull. Play and a miss
back of a length outside off, Kohli steers into the covers. Raina to face Steyn now.
expects the short ball, Steyn gives him a full one aimed for the pads. Raina is back on the crease, but manages to work it off the pads to fine leg

Kohli perishes. Almost compelled to make the Powerplay count. Barring a miracle and a dream, this should be the end of India's challenge. Back of a length from Steyn, not there for the whip over the infield. Kholi goes for the shot, but can't time it well enough to clear Smith at midwicket in the circle, who hauls it in. End of a promising innings. Promised a bit today. Promised a lot for the future.
back of a length, beats Bhaj for pace and he plays all around it and misses.
back of a length again, Harbhajan works it off the pads to the leg side
another one angling in towards the pads from back of a length, Harbhajan clips it towards midwicket
angled into Raina's pads from over the wicket and he whips it behind square for one

Harbhajan's stumps are hit. And unlike in Cape Town, the bails have actually fallen this time. Length ball angling across from middle and leg, Harbhajan looks to smear across the line and gets a healthy inside edge onto the furniture. This can be over in a hurry now.
short and wide outside off, Zaheer plays an airy cut towards third man for a single
short ball, aimed at the ribs but sliding down the leg side. Wide called
Raina opens up the stumps as he moves to the leg side, but this ball is even wider and slides down the leg side again
full on off stump, Raina plays it down towards long on for one more
Zaheer goes for a carve over the leg side and fails to connect
he charges out this time, but Parnell frustrates him by taking the pace off. Another wild swing, another miss
Raina muscles Steyn over midwicket. Rare full delivery from Steyn and Raina's eyes light up as he lines him up for the flick over the leg side. Clean connection, lands just inside the rope
he comes down the track this time, but it is even shorter, Raina inside edges and gets a single towards square leg
Zaheer charges away inside the crease with pent-up aggression. Which remains pent up. He ends up defending meekly
looks to smash a short ball down the ground, but can't make good contact. Dribbles away for one
Raina gets inside the line and works Steyn with the angle towards fine leg for one
full and straight, just outside off and Zaheer misses as he exposes the stumps and looks to touch the ball
another one slips down the leg
full-length angling into Raina, who targets midwicket with the pick-up slog once again, but can't make clean contact
short ball, Zaheer attempts to pull, but mistimes towards midwicket
misses another big hit, does Zaheer. He has played a lot of shots for almost no runs. Misses the pull and it goes over the stumps, through to AB
this one is outside leg stump, Zaheer is even further outside leg as he looks to flick violently. Another miss
Zaheer seems to have a run up of his own at the crease, going this way and that as Parnell steams in, and ends up finally getting bat on a full ball on leg stump. Single to deep square leg
Raina mistimes another attempt to go over the leg side, and gets a single for his efforts

Raina welcomes Tsotsobe with a lofted boundary through square leg. This came into his body as Raina was moving away to the leg side. Nice hitting length, and he whacks it high over square leg. One bounce, into the boundary

Raina's adventurous efforts have come to an end. Tsotso puts this one outside off, Raina charges again and looks to slice the cut over the infield, but finds Ingram at point. Easy take, and SA are two wickets away. Boy, this is a long tail.
Tsotso gives him a short ball, zipping across with the angle and Nehra just stays out of harm's way
full outside off, Nehra reluctantly gets into a defensive drive off the front foot
wide called, another one sliding down the leg side
another bouncer slanting across Nehra who lets it go
decides to play at this one, with an open face towards point

Zaheer looks to go straight down the ground, and manages to, but in the opposite direction. Short ball outside off, he looks to hit straight off the back foot and gets an outside edge towards third man
Nehra plays his version of the flick. Or the scoop. It involves chipping the ball straight up on the leg side, between the fielders in the infield.
Nehra's all placement as he backs away, hangs the bat out and bisects the gap between slip and gully. Single to third man
short ball, lifting at Zaheer outside off and he weaves away in clumsy fashion
another swing, another miss from Zaheer. Short ball, good carry and Zaheer plays the pull shot in another zip code
backs away and slashes hard at a short one outside off, and gets a single to third man
short ball aimed at Zaheer who is moving away to the leg side, and he ends up managing a single with a pull shot

ah the joy of seeing a fast bowler fox a tail-ender! Tsotso delivers a full slower ball on leg stump. Nehra barely read the length, he completely failed to notice the change in pace as he went down and attempted to defend it. He was through with the shot with an angled bat when the ball came through and hit the base of leg stump. Sheepish look from Nehra, big smile on Tsotso's face. Fast bowlers - fun when the bowl. More fun when they bat. Most fun when they go face to face.
Munaf backs away and slashes towards third man. He's off the mark

all over. Duminy plucks a superb catch to end the game. Zaheer looks to carve another short ball over the off side, and scoops it up over the covers. JP runs back and puts in a dive to pouch it. India have lost by 135 runs. Their woeful numbers in SA v SA just became more woeful.
